author: Matthew Dalton
title: European Officials Look to Blunt Impact of Renewed U.S. Sanctions on Iran
text:
Senior French and German officials Friday said they were looking to help European firms escape the brunt of the reimposition of U.S. sanctions on Iran, while considering longer-term measures to blunt Washington’s powers to penalize European companies from afar.
In the short term, officials said, governments have little choice but to plead for leniency from the Trump administration, which has been in talks with European capitals after President Donald Trump’s decision this week to withdraw the U.S. from the Iranian nuclear...
